intro: Litsea costalis, commonly known as the fragrant leaf tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, including regions of India, China, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its aromatic, ovate leaves that are often used in traditional medicine and as a source of essential oils. Its small, yellowish-green flowers are followed by oval, woody fruits containing a single seed. Litsea costalis thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils.
